subject: Re: [junit] Run it one by one
msgSnippet: I misunderstood the question. Ignore my response, if you haven t already. ======================================= J. B. Rainsberger, founder, Diaspar Software
messageBody:
I misunderstood the question. Ignore my response, if you haven't already.

=======================================
J. B. Rainsberger,
founder, Diaspar Software Services Inc.
Extreme Programming for the Java platform
Let's build software that humans understand.
http://www.diasparsoftware.com/



J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> Please look at the class junit.extensions.TestSetup, as well as the
> JUnit FAQ that came with the software.
>
> Good luck,
> JBR.
>
> =======================================
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> founder, Diaspar Software Services Inc.
> Extreme Programming for the Java platform
> Let's build software that humans understand.
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
>
>
>
> wenzhe lu wrote:
>
> > Hi,
> > Now I have some trouble. If I have 50 testcase, the JUnit always
> > run setup() 50 times firstly, and then run the testcase one by one.
> > But I need the JUnit to run ONE setup(), one testcase, and the next
> > setup(), the next testcase. How can I do it?
>
>
>
